body.p:
His Excellency
T. E. Bramlette
Gov. of Kentucky,
Sir
In the Powel Circuit Court there are four Forfeitures against Wm Bowen and Wm" Stone as the Securities for one Robt. Milbourne - one Newton Bowen - one Hezekiah Bowen and one Wm Bowen

Said Milbourne & Bowens were indicted for killing one Hall - The three Defts Bowen have always been present at Court except once and then were prevented and frightened from so doing by threats of the relatives of the decd. Hall. At the last Court they were present, and are now in Powel County, being out on ^new^ Bail. Said Milbourne is supposed to be within the rebel lines, and perhaps not living. The Security Wm Bowen - is one of the best citizens of Powel County. I therefore ask your Excellency to remit said forefeitures. The style of the cases are Comth vs Wm Bowen & W. Stone on forfeited Recognizance of Robt Milbourne. - Same vs Same on forfeited Recog. of Newton Bowen, also on that of Hezekiah Bowen. also on that of Wm Bowen ^making four cases^ Each forefeiture is in the sum of $500. Said forfeiture is in the sum of $500. Said forfeitures were ordered at the Nov. Term 1862 of said Court.

The above is about a fair statements of facts in the case, & my per cent being secure, I freely consent to the remission asked above, as I think it would be nothing but justice & right under the peculiar circumstances of the case

J. S. Dury
Comth Atty.
over

Mt. Sterling, Montgomery Co. Ky
Jan 24th 1864
His Excellency
Thos E Bramlette
Gov. of Ky
Sir

Your excellency will remember my being at Frankfort, and endeavoring to get said forfeitures remitted before Judgment and your objecting to it as euchering the Comths Atty. I have now compr^om^ised with him by paying a good proportion of his per cent. In fact nearly all and send evidence to you for a remission according to your direction.

I would send the petition I then had with me and the Afft. - But as you no doubt remember them I suppose they are not requisite. The cases are as follows to wit 1st" Comth of Ky vs Wm Bowen & W. Stone on forfeited Recognizance of Hezekiah Bowen.

2d" Same vs Same on Same of Robert Wilbourne
3d Same vs Same on " of Wm Bowen (son of H Bowen)
4th Same vs Same " " of Newton Bowen.
Each are in the sum of 500.
Please send them to my address as soon as convenient as the Powel Ct. Court comes soon, if your Excellency sees fit.
If not too much of a favor I would be very thankful for two or three copies of Your last message at the same time you send the Remissions, as I failed to get any when down.

I am
Your Obst. Servt.
Wm Henry Holt
Mt Sterling, Ky.

Powell Cir Ct
vs
Wm Bowen & W Stone
4 judgts
$500 each
Remit
17th Feby 1865
sent for fee
Fee $8 -- Paid
